Name: Airbnb
Name_1: Stay in 'Home Alone' house this season through Airbnb and encounter booby traps mac and cheese and a tarantula
Text_1:
CHICAGO -- First it was the Pie House in Deerfield then it was Scottie Pippen's Highland Park home for the Summer Olympics.

Now it's the McCallisters'.

An overnight stay at Winnketka's "Home Alone" house will give up to four guests the chance to relive their favorite scenes from the 1990 holiday classic this month for $25 plus fees and taxes through Airbnb.

The one-night-only stay was available for booking at last week. The home has been designed to look as similar to the movie that made Macaulay Culkin's Kevin McCallister character a household name.

Devin Ratray the actor who played Kevin's older brother Buzz will welcome guests into the McCallister residence via Zoom.

"We may all be older and wiser now but we're never too old for holiday high jinks" "Buzz" said in a statement. "So this year spend the holidays not-so-home-alone at my parents' house."

When guests step through the door they'll take in the bold wallpaper red carpet runner and pictures of Buzz on the wall. Bask in the living room's holiday ambiance with a Christmas tree stockings hung over the fireplace -- the whole gambit. Visitors will sleep in Kevin's parents' room -- complete with four-poster bed father's aftershave vintage clock radio and old school big box television. (Should there be children a second guest bedroom is available as well.)

But the experience will mirror the movie in more ways than one. Empty paint cans stand ready for booby-trap setting '90s-era junk food including Chicago's finest pizza and a candlelit dinner of highly nutritious Kraft macaroni and cheese and a meet-and-greet with Buzz's pet tarantula Axl.

Visitors will also get to view "Home Sweet Home Alone" wherein Ratray reprises his role and take home a Lego Ideas "Home Alone" kit as a memento.

Airbnb reps said they tried to figure out the physics of how the sled scene down the steps would work but opted to have a potential sledding excursion planned instead a safer option. A member of Buzz's "McCallister Security" team will arrange meals.

The suburban home remains an attraction to this day. One just has to sit on the Winnetka street for a brief time before people pull out cameras to take pictures of the "Home Alone" house making it ideal for a nostalgic holiday stay.

In honor of the first-ever stay at the McCallister home Airbnb will make a one-time donation to Chicago's La Rabida Children's Hospital which is dedicated to maintaining and improving the quality of life for patients with complex conditions disabilities and chronic illness.
Name_2: Alabama's Coolest Airbnb Is On Smith Lake: Condé Nast Traveler
Text_2:
CULLMAN COUNTY AL — A home in Crane Hill Ala. on Smith Lake has been chosen by Condé Nast Traveler as the "coolest Airbnb in Alabama."

Condé Nast Traveler chose the best Airbnb in each state and the District of Columbia and made the choices based on which homes "represent the coolest of American cool—aesthetically architecturally and A-plus hospitality." Every listing featured on the list is run by a Superhost with a 4.8 rating or higher.

"The four-bedroom contemporary log cabin puts a more refined spin on #lakelife Pinterest boards trading cliché anchors and oars for a neutral color palette and luxurious linens" the travel magazine says about the home. "In addition to its dockside perch on Lake Smith the wraparound porches media center with a 60-inch TV and rec room with a pool table make this a desirable retreat for up to 12 guests."
Name_3: 15 Best Airbnbs in South Dakota USA (2024 Edition)
Text_3:
If iconic national parks jaw-dropping natural wonders and expansive rugged landscapes appeal to you you may want to consider a trip to South Dakota. Nicknamed the Mount Rushmore State for its famous mountain sculpture this midwestern gem is filled to the brim with interesting museums and unique historic sites.

With so much adventure awaiting you’ll need to find a cozy accommodation to rest your head. Read on for a list of the best Airbnbs in South Dakota created to help you with your search for the best place to stay. To ensure that you’re getting a top-notch accommodation we’ve made sure that all of the rentals listed are hosted by Airbnb superhosts – rental owners with a track record of providing outstanding hospitality.

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Artistic Mid-Century Home Our first house for rent in South Dakota offers a super stylish stay with modern amenities and a ton of natural light. Bright and spacious the magazine-worthy interior boasts massive windows exposed wooden beams and stylish green accents in the form of throw pillows chairs and indoor plants. Guests have access to a modern full kitchen a formal dining room with a hand-painted mural and a comfy living room with a wall-mounted TV and an indoor fireplace. The best feature of the home is the spacious solarium which is perfect for relaxing reading or just soaking up the sun. The rental comes with two large bedrooms with queen-size beds and one full bathroom with a walk-in shower and soothing air jets. The living room sofa makes another great place to crash and your host can provide an additional air mattress for a maximum of seven guests. Additional amenities include Wi-Fi a vintage record player air-conditioning and a private balcony. This beautiful Airbnb in Sioux Falls South Dakota is just a few minutes away from downtown and right around the corner from McKennan Park. The rental encompasses the top floor of a two-family home and offers a completely private stay with the only shared space being the yard. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Mountain Lodge on a Private Estate You’d be hard-pressed to find a South Dakota Airbnb on a nicer property than this private 200-acre estate bordering Black Hills National Forest. Ideal for large groups of up to 10 guests this four-bedroom three-bathroom home is a great option for large families and guests traveling with small children. In addition to the main living room there is a downstairs movie room with a 50-inch HDTV and a recreation area with a pool table. Guests can make and enjoy meals in the eat-in kitchen complete with new appliances and wooden cabinetry. There is no Wi-Fi in the home making this the perfect place to unplug and unwind and convenient amenities such as a dishwasher and a washer and dryer make the space suitable for longer stays. The rental comes with plenty of private outdoor space surrounded by breathtaking mountain views. Outdoor amenities include a large elevated deck with a dining table and a grill a covered lower terrace with a hot tub and a hammock and a private firepit in the yard. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Modern and Stylish Home in the Black Hills Appointed with Wi-Fi a Smart TV a separate laundry room and a dishwasher this pet-friendly house rental in Rapid City South Dakota makes an ultra-comfortable home away from home. Guests have exclusive access to the entire house which includes two bedrooms with queen-size beds and two full bathrooms. The open-concept living area is modern and stylish and comes with plenty of space to relax cook and enjoy a meal with the family. Sliding glass doors next to the kitchen open onto a covered back porch with a grill and a newly installed hot tub. Rapid City is one of the most popular locations in the state and one of the best cities for winter sports and outdoor activities. Located near the Mount Rushmore National Memorial this rental is also in a convenient spot for exploring historic sites and museums. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Secluded Mountain Chalet Situated on 10 private acres next to the Black Hills National Forest this modern cabin for rent in South Dakota boasts a rustic style with luxurious touches. The gorgeous mountain home was recently constructed in 2018 and offers brand-new appliances and a covered patio with a luxurious hot tub. The focal point of the home is the gorgeous living room and its 16-foot windows and stone pillar fireplace. Cow-print furnishings nature-themed artwork and taxidermy wall art mimic the home’s gorgeous mountain setting and the chic full kitchen offers a lengthy breakfast bar and a wooden dining table. Up to eight guests can stay in the cabin which comes with 2.5 bathrooms two bedrooms with queen-size beds one bedroom with bunk beds and a sofa bed in the living room. Although there is no Wi-Fi in the cabin there is cable TV. Feel free to explore the entire property and its incredible hiking trails lush forest and gorgeous rolling hills. There are no neighbors visible from the cabin and if you’re visiting during the winter the ski slopes of Terry Peak are just 15 minutes away. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Micro-Cabin in Pheasant Country Enjoy tiny home living at its finest with this luxurious trailer Airbnb in South Dakota. Ideal for a solo traveler or a couple the renovated studio space features a queen-size bed nestled in the corner and surrounded by three glass walls that bring the outside in. There is also a TV visible from the bed a modern kitchenette a two-person dining table and a full bathroom with a stall shower. This incredible rental offers a simple and cozy experience that is fully equipped with modern comforts and essential facilities. Although the space is certainly tiny the large windows and wide-open scenery make it feel very expansive. Feel free to bring your pets and enjoy world-class hunting on the surrounding land. Get ready to experience the relaxing atmosphere of a remote rental in the middle of nowhere. Set on 640 acres of private land and surrounded by nothing but nature the trailer also offers a front porch with a couple of lounge chairs for enjoying the gorgeous scenery. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Black Hills Bunkhouse This rustic South Dakota Airbnb is set on a working horse ranch in a lightly populated neighborhood just outside of Hot Springs. Hand built from traditional logs the cabin boasts a classic style with Western-themed décor and antique furnishings. Furnished with one queen-size bed and one set of bunk beds the studio space can accommodate up to four guests and is ideal for a small family with two children. The cabin also comes with a private full bathroom and a modern kitchenette with granite countertops and a wooden dining table. Guests traveling with horses and pets are welcome and the ranch offers some incredible natural scenery including fields filled with wildflowers and starry night skies. Black Hills National Forest Wind Cave National Park and Angostura State Park and Lake can all be found just a few miles away along with the urban attractions and local eateries in Hot Springs. View on Airbnb

Related: 15 Best Cabin Rentals in the Black Hills SD

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Modern A-Frame Cabin in Lead Whether you’re visiting in the dead of winter the heat of summer or anytime in between this luxurious cabin is one of the best Airbnbs in South Dakota for outdoor adventurers. With two full bathrooms three bedrooms and four queen-size beds the spacious two-story cabin is suitable for large groups of up to eight people. The interior is rustic and chic with dark wood finishes black and gray accents dazzling skylights and a full wall of windows. The main floor boasts a cozy living room with a brown leather sectional and a wall-mounted TV as well as an open kitchen with a granite dining table. This one-of-a-kind cabin rental in South Dakota even offers a private patio with a hot tub and a cozy firepit area surrounded by Adirondack chairs. Additional modern amenities include high-speed Wi-Fi an indoor fireplace a dishwasher and a washer and dryer. The city of Lead is nestled in the Northern Black Hills and offers an endless selection of outdoor activities and unique sites and museums related to its interesting mining history. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Creekside Cabin in Custer Another great option for a secluded stay in nature is this ultra-modern cabin in the middle of the Black Hills. The interior features a stunning open floor plan with high-end furnishings massive windows and eye-catching black beams. Glass doors make the space bright and airy and lead out to a private patio elevated among the trees. Hanging light fixtures create a fun atmosphere in the full kitchen and the dining area and the spacious living room is warm and cozy with gorgeous orange chairs and a bohemian-style rug. The cabin is family-friendly and can accommodate up to six guests with three bedrooms and two full bathrooms. The space is also appointed with an impressive selection of modern amenities including Wi-Fi TV and a washer and dryer. Located near Mount Rushmore Crazy Horse Memorial and Custer State Park this beautiful Airbnb in South Dakota makes a convenient home base for all kinds of adventure. The property’s soothing stream is a very pleasant addition to the beautiful natural scenery and the cozy firepit out front is the perfect place to stargaze after sundown. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Green Mountain Cabin Set in a small mountain town in the Boxelder Creek Valley this cozy cabin is one of the best South Dakota Airbnbs for a relaxing retreat with easy access to major Black Hills attractions. Originally built in the 1910s the rustic abode offers cathedral ceilings and a stone fireplace along with a slew of new amenities like Wi-Fi TV and air-conditioning. With two full bathrooms two bedrooms two queen-size beds and one set of bunk beds the cabin can easily sleep up to six guests and welcomes families with young children. There is also a well-equipped full kitchen a cozy main-floor living room and a second living area in the lofted lounge. Step outside to enjoy the cabin’s private porch or take off hiking directly from the property. Mountain and valley views await at this incredible cabin surrounded by miles of greenery. With golf courses restaurants and creeks nearby guests will have plenty of opportunities for fishing skiing and birding. There is truly something for everything in this abundant part of South Dakota. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Coyote Ridge Lodge Originally constructed in the 1970s this handbuilt Airbnb in South Dakota offers a one-of-a-kind stay on 10 acres of ponderosa forest. The rustic cabin has been fully updated to include comfortable modern amenities such as Wi-Fi a Smart TV and a washer and dryer. The interior is rugged and weathered but absolutely gorgeous with unique walnut flooring and bay windows. The large living room is furnished with a queen-size bed and a futon and doubles as a second bedroom and the lofted sleeping area offers another queen-size bed. There are also 1.5 bathrooms a corner kitchen and a convenient desk space. If you’re interested in this rental but you need some more space or privacy there is a bunkhouse on the property that sleeps four more people and is available to rent in conjunction with the main cabin. Together the cabin and the bunkhouse can sleep up to 10 guests. Almost every outdoor activity you could possibly imagine can be found somewhere on or around the property and the tasty eateries and convenient shops of Spearfish are just a few minutes away. Black Hills National Forest is also within walking distance of the cabin and there are endless entertainment options in the nearby town of Deadwood. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Black Hills Glamping This tent Airbnb in Rapid City South Dakota offers a rustic glamping experience for solo travelers adventurous couples and small groups of up to four people. The tent is elevated on a wooden platform and offers an attached deck that overlooks the forested mountainside. Furnished with a luxurious queen-size bed and a full-size mattress the space is private and cozy. Both ends of the tent open up to allow the cool mountain breeze to flow through the space and the deck fireplace will keep you nice and warm on chilly nights. There is also a wood-fired stove for making coffee and basic camping meals and guests have access to a private outhouse located 20 feet away from the tent which includes a sink and a heated shower. Near your parking spot you’ll find a relaxing hammock and a picnic table along with a gas grill and a convenient cooler. Pets are welcome to join you in this short-term rental in South Dakota which is surrounded by a ton of great hiking trails. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Farm Barn Loft For a comfy vacation rental in South Dakota with a unique rural setting and an abundance of farm animals check out this modern barn loft. The private rental offers one bedroom with a full-size bed and one full bathroom. Additional sleeping arrangements include two couches and an air mattress making the loft suitable for up to six guests. The interior is modern and stylish with rustic accents like wood-planked ceilings and sliding barn doors. There is a small kitchenette with a minifridge a coffee maker and a microwave and guests will be able to use the stove on the lower level of the barn upon request. Indoor entertainment options include a TV space and a bar area with a ping pong table a pool table and pinball machines. Outside guests are welcome to mingle with the goats donkey and alpaca and go hunting in the surrounding area. Lake Herman and Lake Madison are also nearby and your hosts are happy to provide a carrier in case you’d like to bring your dog. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Historic Cottage in Rapid City This historic vacation home for rent in South Dakota boasts a convenient location in a charming and walkable neighborhood. Recently renovated the historic cottage was built in 1917 and offers a gorgeous interior with soaring ceilings white walls blue accents and rustic details like exposed beams and a brick pillar. With three bedrooms two queen-size beds and four single beds the home can sleep up to eight guests. There are also two full bathrooms in the cottage one of which offers a luxurious steam shower and heated floors. Additional modern amenities include Wi-Fi TV laundry facilities complimentary breakfast and a great selection of baby gear and children’s toys for guests traveling with young kids. There are several local restaurants nearby and the cottage offers a fully stocked kitchen with stainless-steel appliances in case you prefer to cook your meals at home. Guests can enjoy meals inside at the dining table or in the fresh air at the picnic table. Outside you’ll find a private backyard with a covered patio and a natural gas firepit which is accessible by a set of French doors in one of the bedrooms. Located within walking distance of downtown Rapid City this South Dakota Airbnb offers easy access to endless activities. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Squirrel Hill Cabin Nearing the end of our list is an Airbnb in South Dakota with a ton of private outdoor space and a great selection of luxurious amenities. Large groups of friends and family will find that this modern cabin is incredibly spacious and well equipped. There are three traditional bedrooms furnished with one king-size bed and two queen-size beds as well as two traditional full bathrooms. The third bedroom can be found in a separate bunkhouse connected by a deck and offers two queen-size beds and its own full bathroom. The full kitchen is very impressive with high-end appliances and a quaint bay window and the cabin comes with a formal dining room fit for the entire group. There is also a fun game room with a huge selection of indoor entertainment options including a foosball table a dart board an air hockey table a Smart TV and more. Situated on three private acres in the Black Hills Squirrel Hill Cabin comes with a vast plot of land to explore. In the backyard you’ll find a charming gazebo nestled in the trees a gorgeous wooden picnic table that can seat up to 10 guests a relaxing hammock a propane firepit and a children’s playset. There are also multiple decks all around the home one of which comes with a brand-new hot tub and is lit up by the glimmer of string lights. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Quaint Escape With Luxurious Amenities The last South Dakota Airbnb on our list is another luxurious rental with a convenient location and hotel-style amenities. Up to seven guests can sleep comfortably in the four-bedroom two-bathroom cabin which also comes with a full kitchen with stainless-steel appliances and a dishwasher. The main living room can be found upstairs with a large dining table a stone fireplace a piano and grand windows that provide incredible views. The second living room is on the lower level of the cabin and offers a wet bar a giant projector screen and a ping pong table. The high-speed Wi-Fi and separate office make this a great choice for travelers who would like to get some work done during their trip and the in-unit washer and dryer make it ideal for longer stays. Outside you’ll find a brand-new jetted hot tub and a large wrap-around deck complete with patio furniture. Nestled on six acres of private land in the Black Hills the cabin offers breathtaking cliffside views and is only about 10 minutes away from the urban attractions of downtown Rapid City. View on Airbnb

No matter what you have planned for your upcoming trip you can’t go wrong resting your head in one of the best Airbnb rentals in South Dakota.
Name_4: Airbnb v Long-Lets: the benefits of holiday-lets for ...
Text_4:
As of December 2020 over 80 per cent of property owners on Airbnb had signed up for this to help meet a surge in demand from people looking to move for new work placements students needing a place to stay for a term or two or those who simply want a change of scene for a few months following a year of lockdowns.

In April 2020 Airbnb introduced new features making it easier than ever for hosts to accept ‘long term’ bookings at their properties meaning people could book stays of 28 days or more.

Airbnb can make life easier for UK landlords by increasing yields simplifying the rental process and providing peace of mind against damage. While the online booking platform built its reputation on providing short term holiday lets this trend is changing.

For many landlords having a few short-term lets can help enhance a property portfolio and the benefits include dependable income less prohibitive regulation and reduced workload especially when the services of an Airbnb management company are used. There is a wealth of opportunities for landlords.

Higher return on investment - Traditionally the disadvantage of short-term lets is that they are more likely to have long vacant periods. However now people have the option to sign up for several months at a time landlords can secure long-term bookings and therefore more predictable income streams. The nature of Airbnb enables hosts to charge a higher rate than they would for regular tenants on Assured Shorthold Tenancies. For example in London Airbnb’s UK Insights report revealed that a typical host in London earned £74.28 a night and when this is compared to the average monthly rental income in London of £1430 reported by the Office for National Statistics in 2021 you get the following:

- Potential annual income from long term tenants: £17160

- Potential annual income from Airbnb (if booked 365 days a year): £27112.20

There are of course a lot of caveats to the above.

High occupancy rates on Airbnb depend on factors like property location and facilities and it is unlikely you’ll have it booked every single night - although this is where offering long-term lets can be particularly useful to guarantee occupancy. There are also local restrictions to be aware of such as the London 90-day rule (which limits the number of days you can host in the capital to 90 days per year) which will affect the amount of income you can earn. Still when considering the potential ratio for return on investment the above numbers show there can be significant benefits to using Airbnb.

Simplified tenancy process - There is a lot of regulation involved with being a landlord. Not only do you need to conduct multiple risk assessments and health and safety checks but there’s also a whole stack of rules around signing up new tenants including referencing and handling deposits.

While these regulations are rightly there to protect tenants from bad landlords they can add a lot of stress and delay to the tenancy process. On the other hand Airbnb hosts are constrained by much less regulation than regular landlords when it comes to tenancies. You will still need to comply with health and fire safety legislation and it makes good business sense to keep your property in a nice condition to attract more bookings. You’ll need to provide your tenants with a safe clean and comfortable experience - but any good landlord should be doing that anyway.

Peace of mind against damage - It’s a scenario landlords are all too familiar with; at the end of the tenancy your tenant leaves the property only for you to go round and discover that they’ve wrecked the carpets broken a door handle and lost the spare key. Then you are left to fight the tenant to claim the deposit which can take months in severe cases. Even if you are able to recover the funds from the deposit it's often not enough to cover the damage entirely.

The benefit of Airbnb is that when your guests leave the property is immediately checked over and contrary to popular belief wear and tear is greatly reduced with this type of letting. After all your guests are usually out for most of the day and when they are in they won't be having lots of different guests over or moving the furniture around!

While there will always be demand for long-term rentals in the UK using Airbnb for short and longer-term bookings can provide landlords with flexibility and freedom from increasingly prohibitive regulations. However renting properties out in this way can take up more of your time and energy particularly when it comes to queries and changeover.

If this is a concern it may be beneficial to engage the services of an Airbnb property management company who can manage the complete process for you from listing to cleaning as well as deal with any questions disputes or damages that may arise.

Diversifying into Airbnbs can be a lucrative move providing a higher return on investment with much less input than with traditional tenancies. Better still there are Airbnb management companies who can help take over the process leaving you free to step back and relax in the knowledge that everything is looked after.

Having a mixed portfolio of traditional rentals with Airbnbs can be a great way to balance risk against potential income gain giving landlords greater peace of mind and security.

* James Jenkins-Yates is the founder and CEO of Houst (formerly Airsorted) *

Name_5: 15 Best Airbnbs in New York USA (2024 Edition)
Text_5:
Filled to the brim with must-see attractions and natural wonders New York State is a highly desirable vacation destination offering everything from urban points of interest and welcoming beaches to lakeside activities and secluded mountain getaways. Visitors can head upstate where the gorgeous natural scenery is dotted with quaint towns and state parks or enjoy a family-friendly vacation on a fun-filled farm. The list of things to do and see in the Empire State is practically endless and no matter what kind of vacation you’re looking for you’re sure to find a great accommodation with Airbnb.

To give you a sense of the vast array of fabulous rentals available we’ve compiled the following list of the best Airbnbs in New York. The rentals on this list are located in various geographical positions throughout the state and each one is hosted by a superhost so you can be sure you’re getting the best of the best. For those unfamiliar with Airbnb superhosts have a proven track record of providing exceptional hospitality and receiving stellar reviews.

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb The Willow Treehouse First up is a treehouse for rent in New York that overlooks a small pond and a luscious forest. Ideal for a solo traveler or a couple the elevated cabin offers a sizable sleeping loft with large windows and a king-size bed. On the main floor you’ll find a cozy living room with a woodstove a cow-print rug and a comfy sofa facing a glass wall that looks out toward the pond and the distant mountains. Next to the living area there is a full kitchen with stainless-steel appliances and the treehouse offers one full bathroom. Outdoor amenities include a spacious deck with patio furniture a grill and a luxurious Swedish hot tub that is heated by a wood-burning stove. Nestled on 34 acres of property in the small town of Willow the treehouse is quiet and secluded yet only 15 minutes away from Woodstock. The pond on the property is swimmable and private and shared only with the host’s main home. View on Airbnb

Related: 15 Best Airbnbs in Woodstock NY

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Sustainable Catskills Cabin This black A-frame in Kerhonkson is one of the best Airbnbs in New York for anyone looking to explore the Catskills in style. Originally built in 1961 the cabin boasts a tasteful combination of modern finishes and original features like wood-planked ceilings and exposed beams. Attractive hanging lights and massive walls of windows create a chic and stylish atmosphere and there is a small lofted lounge with a cool hanging chair. The spacious living room offers two comfy sofas and an indoor fireplace bordered by painted white brick. There is also an impressive chef’s kitchen with stainless-steel appliances and a separate dining room. With two full bathrooms and two bedrooms with queen-size beds the space is ideal for small groups of up to four guests. Outside you’ll find a screened-in gazebo a private patio with a relaxing hammock and a large backyard decorated with string lights. The property also offers a spring-fed pond and wooded scenery and the neighborhood is friendly and quiet. Named the coolest A-frame in the state by the New York Post this Airbnb in Upstate New York definitely lives up to its impressive ratings. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Adirondack Mountainside A-Frame For another great Airbnb cabin in New York check out this cozy A-frame overlooking Whiteface Mountain. The cabin’s unique architecture features a classic facade with white planks and a red door and the back wall is made entirely of windows that provide gorgeous views and a ton of natural light. The interior is equipped with a mix of antique features and modern amenities and offers one lofted bedroom with a full-size bed and one full bathroom. The main floor offers a comfy living area with an indoor fireplace and a full kitchen with a functional vintage stove. Glass doors in the back of the cabin open onto a private patio complete with outdoor furniture a cozy firepit and a stainless-steel grill. This New York Airbnb is pet friendly and comes with a slew of modern amenities such as Wi-Fi TV and laundry facilities. Nestled on 30 private acres the cabin is surrounded by exciting hiking opportunities and is also just 20 minutes away from Lake Placid. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Casa Minnewaska If you’re looking for an Airbnb in New York suitable for large groups and surrounded by outdoor activities consider this gorgeous three-bedroom cabin overlooking the Catskills. Recently renovated this rustic hillside abode has been fully equipped with modern amenities and luxurious features. The cozy living room features a wall-mounted TV and a stone fireplace and the open layout connects the space to a modern kitchen with pastel blue cabinetry. Furnished with a king-size bed a queen-size bed two double beds and a sofa bed the space is suitable for up to 10 guests and each bedroom comes with its own full bathroom. Outside you’ll find a massive wrap-around deck with a luxurious hot tub a large outdoor dining table and a grill. Bordering 22000 acres of untouched wilderness the five-acre property offers convenient opportunities for climbing fishing hiking swimming skiing and more. The backyard leads directly into Minnewaska State Park and is a great addition for guests traveling with children or pets. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Simple Cottage on Cayuga Lake This lakeside vacation rental in New York offers a clean warm and comfortable stay with direct waterfront access. The interior is bright and airy with floor-to-ceiling windows and white finishes. There are two sleeping areas with convenient curtains for privacy one with a convertible queen-size bed and one with a full-size bed. The modern kitchen boasts stainless-steel appliances and the four-person dining table is pushed up against a wall of windows offering gorgeous lake views. Fully appointed with modern amenities the bungalow also comes with Wi-Fi and a combined washer-dryer. The newly remodeled bathroom features a gorgeous stone floor and a nature-inspired ceiling mural depicting a canopy of trees. Outside you’ll find a lovely shaded patio overlooking the lake and a short set of stone steps leading directly into the water. There is also a dining table right at the water’s edge for lakeside dining and the rental comes with two kayaks. Guests can take a short walk up to the stream to a beautiful waterfall or travel a few minutes to a golf course and a winery. Located in the quaint town of King Ferry the cabin offers a peaceful and private setting surrounded by a friendly community with a few local shops and eateries. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Glass House in the Hudson Valley Enjoy a romantic and secluded stay in wine country with this off-grid oasis completely enclosed in glass. Ideal for a single guest or a couple the small space is furnished with a queen-size bed that is surrounded by three walls of glass. Enjoy endless views of lush vineyards and expansive rolling hills in the daytime and stargaze at night. The studio space is also equipped with a modern stainless-steel kitchenette a two-person breakfast table and a full bathroom. Although the space is tiny it is extremely comfortable and well equipped with Wi-Fi air-conditioning and a massive backyard with a cozy firepit. Nestled on 30 acres of farmland this gorgeous New York Airbnb is surrounded by wildlife yet only 90 minutes away from New York City. The farm is filled with gorgeous apple orchards and the property is shared by the host’s main home. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Modern Upstate Cabin With a heated pool available year-round this luxurious pet-friendly cabin in Red Hook offers the ultimate relaxing retreat. Gorgeous walls of glass border the living room and the lofted bedroom area and the master bedroom features a queen-size bed and a romantic soaking tub. The entire cabin is fitted with heated floors and a modern indoor fireplace to keep the living room toasty warm in the winter months and the custom kitchen is perfectly suited for whipping up a gourmet meal. In addition to the luxurious in-ground pool the backyard comes with a separate dining area a relaxing hammock and an outdoor shower. The most notable aspect of this unique rental is the separate glass-enclosed solarium which boasts an extra bed and a woodstove and makes the perfect place to stargaze and enjoy the scenery. This one-of-a-kind Airbnb in New York is set on 3.5 private acres of wilderness and offers easy access to several quaint upstate towns. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Cottage by the Water For a gorgeous New York City rental on the water check out this spacious Airbnb in Queens New York. The two-bedroom 1.5-bathroom cottage is bright and spacious with soaring ceilings and an open and airy layout. Light wood planks and modern hanging lights add to the stylish atmosphere of the massive living room which offers a black leather sofa and a wall-mounted TV. There is also an open full kitchen with a breakfast bar and a formal dining table surrounded by three walls of windows that allow you to eat right on the water. The main-floor bedroom is furnished with two twin-size beds and a desk and the second bedroom is lofted above the common areas and offers a queen-size bed another small desk and incredible water views. The back porch hovers right over the water and additional amenities include Wi-Fi laundry facilities and complimentary breakfast items. Conveniently situated near John F. Kennedy International Airport in the charming neighborhood of Howard Beach the cottage comes with two free parking spots and is just a short walk away from the nearest subway entrance. Howard Beach is right on the water and features several great parks beaches restaurants and delis. View on Airbnb

Related: 15 Best Airbnbs in New York City NY

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Goat Farm Yurt This unique short-term rental in New York offers a rustic off-grid retreat on a farm surrounded by woodland. The cozy yurt is in a secluded area on the farm making this a very private stay. Furnished with a full-size Murphy bed the space is ideal for a couple but your hosts can provide two cots and sleeping bags for extra guests. Inside of the yurt you’ll also find a small wash basin a limited kitchen area stocked with treats and a warm woodstove. Outside there is an antique outhouse a heated outdoor shower a private porch and a hammock. Guests are welcome to mingle with the goats on the property and there is some food for them stored in the kitchen. You can also enroll in goat yoga which takes place on the property and there are several other animals on the farm. Nearby are the Schenectady and Amsterdam train stations to which your hosts can provide you with a private shuttle service for another additional fee. The immediate area is filled with tasty restaurants and hiking swimming and kayaking opportunities. There are also zip lines and rope courses about 30 minutes away at Mountain Ridge Adventure as well as skiing and tubing at Maple Ski Ridge. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Luxurious Adirondack Treehouse Set right on the edge of the Adirondack Park this Airbnb treehouse in New York offers an ultra-modern interior with massive walls of windows exposing the incredible natural scenery. Up to four guests can stay in the treehouse which offers one bedroom with a king-size bed one bedroom with a set of bunk beds and a luxurious full bathroom with brass showerheads and gorgeous tilework. The grand living room boasts elegant furnishings stylish décor a modern indoor fireplace and a wall-mounted TV and the master bedroom comes with its own TV an elegant sitting area and a breathtaking crystal chandelier. There is also a gourmet full kitchen with stainless-steel appliances and a small dining area. The treehouse is elevated 14 feet above the ground and can be reached by an 80-foot suspension bridge leading to a massive wrap-around porch. You won’t need to travel far to take advantage of the area’s fantastic outdoor activities which include snowmobiling boating hunting fishing and hiking. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Waterfront Cabin in Northville Another spectacular cabin in the Adirondacks this waterfront home is one of the best New York Airbnbs for travelers interested in the state’s world-renowned outdoor activities. With three bedrooms and 1.5 bathrooms the wood-planked cabin can comfortably sleep up to six guests. The first floor of the home offers a warm and cozy living room an eat-in full kitchen with a fireplace a master bedroom and a full bathroom with a Jacuzzi and a washer and dryer. On the second floor you’ll find the other two bedrooms and the half bedroom as well as a small workspace. Additional amenities include Wi-Fi a Smart TV a Bluetooth sound system and central heat and air-conditioning. Outside of the cabin the lovely front deck the screened-in porch and the cozy firepit offer incredible river views. Set on a secluded dead-end road this Airbnb in New York offers 10 miles of walkable land along the river. At Great Sacandaga Lake just three miles away you can also rent a boat or lounge on the beach. Feel free to swim fish and kayak in the river hike around the property and snowshoe in the winter or travel five minutes to the town of Northville for shopping and dining. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Stunning Hamptons Getaway If you’re looking for luxury you can’t go wrong with a poolside retreat in the Hamptons. This designer vacation home for rent in New York offers an ultra-modern interior complete with three gorgeous bedrooms and two brand-new bathrooms. The master bedroom comes with a TV a small workspace and patio access and the bathrooms boast sparkling walk-in showers and granite countertops. There is a bright and cozy living room with an elegant indoor fireplace and a wall-mounted TV in an open-concept living space with the dining area and a full kitchen. The gourmet chef’s kitchen features stainless-steel appliances and a granite breakfast bar and is positioned next to a set of sliding glass doors. Step outside to enjoy a spacious dining area comfy patio furniture professional landscaping and an inground heated pool. Pets are allowed in the home on a case-by-case basis and modern amenities include Wi-Fi a dishwasher and a washer and dryer. Set on a half-acre of land this New York Airbnb is perfect for anyone interested in a luxurious retreat with easy access to golf courses and the beach. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb The Happy Camper Bus This one-of-a-kind cabin on wheels was once a school bus and now functions as a semirustic vacation rental in Upstate New York. Furnished with a king-size bed and a sofa bed the bus is surprisingly spacious and can sleep up to four guests. The cozy common areas are warmed by a small woodstove and feature a full kitchen with stainless-steel appliances and bar-style seating for two. The bus is equipped with electricity and a composting toilet and there is a shared full bathroom available next door. Guests will also have access to a shared recreation room equipped with picnic tables and games and pets are allowed in the rental. Set on a 60-acre nature sanctuary this unique Airbnb in New York boasts a desirable waterfront property with several hiking trails two ponds a cozy firepit and gardens to explore. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Modern Sanctuary in the Catskills Next on our list is a New York Airbnb thoughtfully crafted to maximize the privacy and beauty of its spectacular mountain setting. The converted trailer comes with a large furnished deck a cozy outdoor firepit and a spacious backyard filled with flower gardens. The interior is bright and stylish with floor-to-ceiling windows light-colored furnishings and gold accents. Rustic tin ceilings and wood finishes tastefully combine with bohemian décor and colorful accents. There is an open-concept living space offering a combined living and dining area as well as a modern full kitchen with a breakfast bar. Two bedrooms with queen-size beds and two full bathrooms make the space well suited for four guests and the master bathroom offers a deep soaking tub next to a large window for ultimate relaxation. Pets are allowed in the rental and modern amenities include Wi-Fi TV and laundry facilities. Susan’s Pleasant Pheasant Farm is located within walking distance of the home and offers kayak and bike rentals. There is also a local farmers market open every Saturday a nearby lake and convenient opportunities for hiking fishing hunting cycling horseback riding and golfing. View on Airbnb

Photo: Courtesy of Airbnb Whispering Wind Treehouse The last Airbnb on our list is another impressive treehouse rental that connects its guests to the gorgeous natural scenery of upstate New York. With no electricity or Wi-Fi this rustic abode offers a true off-grid retreat for solo travelers adventurous couples or small groups looking to unplug and unwind among a canopy of trees. There is a full-size bed in the elevated sleeping loft and a cozy futon on the main floor. The glass walls provide stunning views and the private porch is a great place to enjoy the surrounding nature. In the winter the treehouse is warmed by a propane heater and guests will have access to an outhouse next door as well as a shared outdoor shower. Fresh well water is provided for drinking and washing and the rental comes with a camp stove a propane grill an outdoor firepit and a great selection of cooking supplies and coffee items. The treehouse is set on over five acres of wooded land which is shared with a few other cabins and a diverse array of wildlife and guests are welcome to explore. If you’re interested in a treehouse rental in New York but the above properties are booked for your dates check out this treehouse or this one instead. View on Airbnb

There you have the best Airbnb rentals in New York. Whether you’re looking for a romantic getaway in the woods or a convenient stay on a New York City beach Airbnb has you covered.

Name_2: A Look Back at Ole Miss' History in the Sugar Bowl
Text_2:
The Rebels punched their ticket to New Orleans with a 10-win regular season. Here are the other instances of the Rebels in the Sugar Bowl.

Ole Miss secured its first 10-win regular season in school history in 2021 and the Rebels were rewarded with a berth in the Allstate Sugar Bowl as a result.

The Rebels will take on Big 12 champion Baylor on the night of Jan. 1 in the Caesers Superdome in New Orleans and this is Ole Miss' 10th appearance in the Sugar Bowl in program history.

In the modern era the Sugar Bowl has a tie-in with the SEC and Big 12 champion if neither champion reaches the College Football Playoff. If the champion does reach the Playoff the berth falls to the next team in the conference pecking order. Since both of the SEC's top teams Alabama and Georgia reached the CFP this season that berth fell to Ole Miss for the 2021 season.

"Well it's huge. We knew that after winning the Egg Bowl that we were going to be in a major New Year's Six game. It was just a matter of which one. We were already recruiting that day and already doing that." -- Lane Kiffin Sugar Bowl team selection press conference

The Sugar Bowl has been an annual event in college football since Jan. 1 1935 and is tied with the Orange Bowl and Sun Bowl as the second-oldest bowl games in the sport behind the Rose Bowl. Once Ole Miss plays this season's installment of the game on New Year's Day it will move into sole possession of fourth-place all-time in Sugar Bowl appearances behind Alabama (16) LSU (13) and Georgia (11).

Here are the results of Ole Miss' previous Sugar Bowl berths.

Jan. 1 1953 -- Georgia Tech 24 Ole Miss 7

Ole Miss' first appearance in the Sugar Bowl came after the 1952 season against Georgia Tech who at that time was still a member of the Southeastern Conference. Ole Miss' only score in the game came in the first quarter when it jumped out to a 7-0 lead but it was all Yellow Jackets from that point on.

With the win Georgia Tech was named National Champion by five of the nation's polls.

Jan. 1 1955 -- Navy 21 Ole Miss 0

The Rebels' second appearance in the Sugar Bowl under Johnny Vaught went similarly to their first as Ole Miss was shutout by Navy. This installment of the Sugar Bowl is the only appearance in the game in Navy's football history. This put a spoiler on a previously-undefeated season for Ole Miss but the Rebels finished the year ranked No. 6 in the country.

Jan. 1 1958 -- Ole Miss 39 Texas 7

Where Ole Miss had been outscored by a combined 45-7 in its first two appearances in the Sugar Bowl it made up a lot of ground when it faced Texas to conclude the 1957 season steamrolling the Longhorns 39-7. Ole Miss finished that season 9-1-1 with its lone tie coming against Mississippi State in the Egg Bowl.

Jan. 1 1960 -- Ole Miss 21 LSU 0

After its heartbreaking loss to the Tigers earlier in the 1959 season thanks to a Billy Cannon punt return Ole Miss bounced back against its rival in the Sugar Bowl. Syracuse was declared the National Champion by the Associated Press but Ole Miss was retroactively given the title as well by multiple polls giving it its first claim to a football national title in school history.

Jan. 2 1961 -- Ole Miss 14 Rice 6

In what was Rice's only appearance in the Sugar Bowl Ole Miss laid claim to another national championship following the 1960 season. Ole Miss finished the season 10-0-1 with its lone tie coming against LSU in Oxford. The Rebels were named National Champions by the Football Writers Association of America.

Jan. 1 1963 -- Ole Miss 17 Arkansas 13

During the 1962 season the Ole Miss campus was metaphorically ablaze with the enrollment of James Meredith in Oxford ending the university's history of racial segregation. With this scene grabbing national headlines the Ole Miss football team was as well going 10-0 with a win over Arkansas in the Sugar Bowl.

This season remains as Ole Miss' only undefeated and untied football season in school history. The Rebels were retroactively named National Champions by three polls.

Jan. 1 1964 -- Alabama 12 Ole Miss 7

Ole Miss suffered its first loss in the Sugar Bowl since 1955 when it fell to Alabama following the 1963 season. The Rebels finished this season 7-1-2 with the Sugar Bowl being its only loss of the campaign. The Ole Miss regular season was bookended by ties to Memphis State and Mississippi State.

Jan. 1 1970 -- Ole Miss 27 Arkansas 22

The Rebels concluded their 1969 season with a Sugar Bowl win over Arkansas for the second time in the last decade. This was the final Sugar Bowl appearance in the head coaching tenure of Johnny Vaught and the last Sugar Bowl appearance for Ole Miss until the 2015 season.

Jan. 1 2016 -- Ole Miss 48 Oklahoma State 20

In what will forever be remembered as the pinnacle of the Hugh Freeze era in Oxford Ole Miss dominated Oklahoma State in New Orleans to open the year 2016. The Rebels finished this season 10-3 its first 10-win season since 2003 and would not reach the postseason again until the 2020 season in year one under Lane Kiffin.

The 2017-2019 seasons were overshadowed by NCAA sanctions in Oxford left behind by Freeze's tenure. Although numerous games were vacated as a part of NCAA sanctions the 2015 season including the Sugar Bowl remained untouched in the record books.

Jan. 1 2021 -- Ole Miss vs. Baylor

As mentioned above this is Ole Miss' 10th appearance all-time in the Sugar Bowl. The Rebels and Bears have faced each other one time in the two schools' history a 20-10 win by Baylor in 1975. These two teams were originally scheduled to open the 2020 season at a neutral site but the COVID-19 pandemic sent the college football world into a landscape made up largely of conference-only schedules last year and that matchup fell victim as a result.

Ole Miss and Baylor will kick off at 7:45 p.m. CT on Jan. 1 and the game will be televised on ESPN.

Want the latest in breaking news and insider information on the Rebels? Click Here.

Follow The Grove Report On Facebook and Twitter.
Name_3: Roman Reigns Back On WWE SmackDown Next Week Toni Storm Vs. Charlotte Flair Update
Text_3:
Roman Reigns Back On WWE SmackDown Next Week Toni Storm vs. Charlotte Flair Update

WWE Universal Champion Roman Reigns will be returning to SmackDown on FOX next week.

Reigns has been announced for next Friday's SmackDown form the Allstate Arena near Chicago to continue the feud with Brock Lesnar for WWE Day 1. It was noted that Lesnar will also be there next Friday.

Advertisement

Reigns did not appear on this week's SmackDown as Paul Heyman noted that he was away on a one-week sabbatical to train for the WWE Day 1 bout with Lesnar. This week's SmackDown featured angles with Lesnar and Heyman designed to build to more tension between Reigns and Heyman next week.

SmackDown saw Sami Zayn in a wheelchair with two male nurses open the show and demand a rematch for Reigns due to Lesnar beating him up last week. Heyman interrupted Zayn but then Lesnar interrupted Heyman. Lesnar tried to make friends with Zayn and take him hunting until Heyman riled Lesnar up enough that he snapped and destroyed Zayn and his nurses.

Lesnar was later featured in a backstage segment where he referred to Heyman as still his advocate. He was featured in another segment where he intimidated Adam Pearce over the recent storyline fine and suspension that was handed down. This week's angles with Lesnar speaking were done really well and can be seen below.

Advertisement

WWE managed to get the "#BrockLesnarsFlipPhone" hashtag trending last night after Lesnar pulled out a flip phone during the segment with Pearce. Lesnar wanted to show Pearce a photo of a moose he had killed and gutted and ate while away on suspension but he couldn't figure out how to use the device. Lesnar became frustrated and broke the phone further intimidating Pearce.

In other news for next week's SmackDown the feud between Toni Storm and SmackDown Women's Champion Charlotte Flair is expected to continue. This week's show saw Storm defeat Flair in a non-title Championship Contender match but by DQ. Flair was disqualified after she failed to stop stomping Storm while she was down.

While it was not announced that Storm is the new #1 contender to Flair she should receive the title shot now or at least another chance at earning the title shot. It's possible they announce Storm vs. Flair for next week's SmackDown or likely at the WWE Day 1 pay-per-view on New Year's Day.

Stay tuned for more on next week's SmackDown. Below are a few shots of Lesnar and Storm vs. Flair from this week's show:

Advertisement

Name: Alphabet Inc
Name_1: Google Search Console Coverage Issue Redirect Error Mass Emails
Text_1:
Over the past 24 hours or so Google has sent me dozens of notices from sites I have verified Google Search Console properties with. The notices say "New Coverage issue detected" and the specific error is a "redirect error." Google said it is looking into why all these notices went out.

UPDATE: This was a bug Google confirmed it a day or so later with this tweet:

An internal issue is causing an increase of redirect errors during indexing and associated email notifications. This is not due to any website issues but is due to an internal Google issue. We hope to fix this problem quickly. — Google Search Central (@googlesearchc) December 13 2021

Here is one I received for my corporate site but I received tons it reads:

Coverage issues detected on rustybrick.com To the owner of rustybrick.com: Search Console has identified that your site is affected by 1 Coverage issues: Top Errors Errors can prevent your page or feature from appearing in Search results. The following errors were found on your site: Redirect error We recommend that you fix these issues when possible to enable the best experience and coverage in Google Search.

Here is a screenshot (click to enlarge):

When you click on the fix it link you are taken to the Coverage report drilled down into the Redirect error statuses. Here is a screenshot of that:

Google is looking into the issue but Daniel Waisberg and John Mueller of Google said "We're looking into this..."

Here are some folks tweeting about this with more:

Heads-up I'm seeing a big spike in redirect errors across sites in the Coverage reporting. Those redirects looks fine when analyzing them... Also that coincides w/a crawl stats error for "Server Connectivity" across those sites impacted. I think Googlebot had too much eggnog :) pic.twitter.com/PGY0EkLAcv — Glenn Gabe (@glenngabe) December 12 2021

There are tons of SEOs concerned about this but the good news it is super wide spread so it is likely an issue on Google's end.

Here is how Daniel and John replied:

We're looking into this... — Daniel Waisberg (@danielwaisberg) December 12 2021

More responses from Google on this:

We're looking into it - seems a bit weird given the many people suddenly posting about it. pic.twitter.com/OsIjYCTJQX — 🧀 John 🧀 (@JohnMu) December 12 2021

We're currently looking into these reports - I'll post more when we know more. — 🧀 John 🧀 (@JohnMu) December 12 2021

Forum discussion at Twitter.

UPDATE: This was a bug Google confirmed it a day or so later with this tweet:

An internal issue is causing an increase of redirect errors during indexing and associated email notifications. This is not due to any website issues but is due to an internal Google issue. We hope to fix this problem quickly. — Google Search Central (@googlesearchc) December 13 2021

UPDATE 2: Google also posted a message in the data anomalies in Search Console document that on December 9th and ongoing both in the index coverage and crawl stats reports "An internal issue is causing an increase of redirect errors during indexing and associated email notifications. This is not due to any website issues but is due to an internal Google issue. We hope to fix this problem quickly."

Google also posted notices in the data anomalies document about the redirect errors issue both in the coverage report and crawl stats report https://t.co/oua7jEFC4w pic.twitter.com/wAKdsx0q5l — Barry Schwartz (@rustybrick) December 14 2021

Update 3: Google updated the notice in the data anomalies document saying this runs from December 6th to December 14th so it was resolved after that.
Name_2: Trucks catch up in self-driving vehicle race
Text_2:
Trucks catch up in self-driving vehicle race

As dreams of having driverless cars whizz around cities in the next year or two fizzle focus is turning to autonomous trucks and work machines which have a much easier job of navigating restricted areas with no traffic or pedestrians such as mines and ports

By Nick Carey and Paul Lienert / Reuters OXFORD England





We would all be whizzing round in robotaxis by now if Elon Musk had been right.

Instead fully self-driving vehicles are struggling to get away from the starting grid and some investors are betting that driverless trucks would reach the chequered flag first.

Only a year ago start-ups developing robotaxis were pulling in eight times more funding than firms working on autonomous trucks buses and logistics vehicles but the gap has narrowed dramatically this year.

Oxbotica founder Paul Newman inspects a pickup truck that has been converted into an autonomous vehicle to be tested with a mining company in Oxford England on Oct. 22. Photo: Reuters

With fewer regulatory and technological hurdles trucks operating on major highways fixed delivery routes or in environments far from cyclists and pedestrians such as mines and ports are now being seen as a faster way to generate returns.

In the year through Monday total investment activity for self-driving logistics vehicles leapt fivefold to US$6.5 billion from US$1.3 billion in the same period last year according to start-up data platform PitchBook.

Meanwhile investment activity for robotaxi firms fell 22 percent to US$8.4 billion from US$10.8 billion over the same period the PitchBook data compiled for Reuters shows.

The numbers might even understate the trend as some robotaxi firms such as Alphabet Inc’s Waymo are pumping more cash into their own autonomous trucking operations as well.

In the latest trucking deal Robotic Research said on Thursday that it has raised US$228 million by tapping outside investors for the first time to expand its autonomous trucks buses and logistics vehicles business.

The new money comes from investors including Softbank Group Corp’s Vision Fund 2 Enlightenment Capital and Luminar Technologies which makes lidar sensors used in self-driving vehicles.

Robotic Research chief executive alberto Lacaze told reporters that the company was deploying autonomous vehicles at scale where the business case works for customers “right now.”

“They don’t have to wait until 2025 unlike robotaxis where you need to have the cost of all the sensors come down by an order of magnitude” he said.

OVERPROMISES

As recently as 2019 Tesla Inc’s Musk had promised 1 million robotaxis “next year for sure” but self-driving vehicles that can navigate safely anywhere are still a long way off.

Peter Rawlinson head of electric vehicle (EV) start-up Lucid Motors Inc last month said it would be a decade before fleets of robotaxis hit the roads — even with the most advanced sensors.

PitchBook’s lead mobility analyst Asad Hussain said start-ups such as Gatik which makes autonomous short-haul vans and Nuro with its mini delivery robots could eclipse Waymo and rival Cruise over the next few years in commercializing at scale.

Still while long-haul trucks are easier to automate than robotaxis because major highways are simpler environments than bustling city roads self-driving truck company executives are cautious about how fast they can ramp up.

“We’re very cognizant of the overpromises that the industry has made” said Lu Cheng (呂程) chief executive of self-driving truck technology company TuSimple Holdings Inc which went public in the US in April with a market value of US$8.5 billion.

“The industry understands the complexity of the problem now and that solving it will take a longer time” he said.

For now TuSimple has a fleet of about 50 trucks with safety drivers aboard crisscrossing the US’ warmer southern states but it plans to have a national network covering major US highways by 2024.

That would involve major investments in mapping highways learning how to handle tougher weather and road conditions further north and in new self-driving trucks being developed by Navistar International Corp which is part of Volkswagen AG’s Traton.

‘A LONG JOURNEY’

However rolling out a truly national network could take years as self-driving trucks still face a major challenge: human drivers.

An autonomous vehicle would always hit the brakes if it encounters a “testosterone-laden human male” said Ralf Klaedtke chief technology officer at TE Connectivity which makes sensors and electronic systems to handle masses of self-driving data for the auto industry.

“The autonomous vehicle will always be the slowest in mixed traffic” he said.

Paul Newman founder of British autonomous vehicle software start-up Oxbotica said robotaxis remained his “North Star” his clear long-term goal.

However for now he is focusing on simpler applications some of which use a purpose-built fully electric self-driving vehicle from Australian start-up Applied EV.

“This is a long journey” he said while showing off test vehicles at the company’s headquarters in Oxford England. “It’s one of the hardest engineering problems to solve.”

Oxbotica is working on vehicles for mines in partnership with Wenco part of Hitachi Construction Machinery Co and on many different options with energy company BP PLC such as vehicles for remote wind and solar farms.

Morag Watson BP’s senior vice president for digital science and engineering said Oxbotica’s technology could monitor large sites or haul equipment out to humans undertaking repairs.

She said they would be testing many different options next year.

“We’ve barely scratched the surface of what we can do with industrial autonomy” Watson said.

Oxbotica is also working with British online food delivery and technology company Ocado Group PLC which automates supply chain systems for the likes of US retail chain Kroger Co. BP and Ocado have both invested in Oxbotica.

Alex Harvey Ocado’s head of advanced technology said Oxbotica’s technology could be used “in the warehouse in the yard on the road or kerb to kitchen.”

NO LEFT TURNS

US autonomous EV maker Outrider has targeted distribution yards — picking up trailers after truckers drop them off and lining up new ones to be hauled away — including at a Chicago yard for paper company Georgia-Pacific LLC.

Outrider has developed a robot arm for the truck to connect and disconnect trailers. It has raised US$118 million so far and chief executive Andrew Smith says it would scale up to thousands of vehicles over the next five years.

The start-up wants to start doing short hops between yards but operating on public roads adds complexity Smith said.

“We saw through the early hype of the technology and recognized distribution yards were the perfect near-term solution with their repetitive low-speed operations in confined environments” he said.

Going out on public roads requires moving carefully partly because of regulations but also because of legal pitfalls in a litigious market such as the US.

Ian White chief executive of digital insurer Koffie Labs Inc said a “black-swan billion-dollar” crash could wipe out any company that moves too fast and gets it wrong.

“You’d be putting your balance sheet on the line” he said.

That is why Gatik has opted for a careful approach for its “middle-mile” delivery routes between distribution centers and retailers chief executive Gautam Narang said.

Gatik’s trucks run on short predictable routes avoiding left turns across oncoming traffic schools hospitals fire stations blind turns — or anything complicated.

“We’re not working on every tricky situation the autonomous vehicle industry is trying to solve” he said. “We’re taking baby steps using routes that are uneventful from a complexity standpoint.”

Gatik works with Walmart Inc and Loblaw Companies Ltd using autonomous trucks with safety drivers although it operates some driverless routes in Arkansas and sees the global shortage of drivers as an opportunity.

“We decided to focus on a simpler use case where the need was very acute” Narang said. “We’re not building the technology for technology’s sake.”

Alex Harvey Ocado’s head of advanced technology said Oxbotica’s technology could be used “in the warehouse in the yard on the road or kerb to kitchen.”

NO LEFT TURNS

US autonomous EV maker Outrider has targeted distribution yards — picking up trailers after truckers drop them off and lining up new ones to be hauled away — including at a Chicago yard for paper company Georgia-Pacific LLC.

Outrider has developed a robot arm for the truck to connect and disconnect trailers. It has raised US$118 million so far and chief executive Andrew Smith says it would scale up to thousands of vehicles over the next five years.

The start-up wants to start doing short hops between yards but operating on public roads adds complexity Smith said.

“We saw through the early hype of the technology and recognized distribution yards were the perfect near-term solution with their repetitive low-speed operations in confined environments” he said.

Going out on public roads requires moving carefully partly because of regulations but also because of legal pitfalls in a litigious market such as the US.

Ian White chief executive of digital insurer Koffie Labs Inc said a “black-swan billion-dollar” crash could wipe out any company that moves too fast and gets it wrong.

“You’d be putting your balance sheet on the line” he said.

That is why Gatik has opted for a careful approach for its “middle-mile” delivery routes between distribution centers and retailers chief executive Gautam Narang said.

Gatik’s trucks run on short predictable routes avoiding left turns across oncoming traffic schools hospitals fire stations blind turns — or anything complicated.

“We’re not working on every tricky situation the autonomous vehicle industry is trying to solve” he said. “We’re taking baby steps using routes that are uneventful from a complexity standpoint.”

Gatik works with Walmart Inc and Loblaw Companies Ltd using autonomous trucks with safety drivers although it operates some driverless routes in Arkansas and sees the global shortage of drivers as an opportunity.

“We decided to focus on a simpler use case where the need was very acute” Narang said. “We’re not building the technology for technology’s sake.”

Name: Altria
Name_1: Alfonso L. Carney Jr. '70
Text_1:
Alfonso L. Carney Jr. ’70 appointed chairman of Dormitory Authority of the State of New York

Alfonso L. Carney Jr. has been appointed chairman of the Dormitory Authority of the State of New York by Governor David A. Paterson. The Dormitory Authority founded in 1944 is the largest higher education health care and public-purpose bonding and construction authority in the nation. The authority has a construction pipeline of 734 projects valued at $7.4 billion and has an outstanding bond portfolio of more than $38 billion.

“I am honored by the responsibility and tremendous opportunity that Governor Paterson has placed before me” Carney says. “My goal is to continue the tradition of strong leadership at the Dormitory Authority and extend its stellar national reputation for professionalism in public finance and construction management.”

Carney an attorney became a principal of Rockwood Partners LLC in 2005. The firm provides medical and legal consulting services to a variety of clients in New York City.

While consulting for Rockwood he served as acting chief operating officer and corporate secretary for the Goldman Sachs Foundation in New York where working with the president of the foundation he directed overall staff management; provided strategic oversight of the administration communications and legal affairs teams; and developed selected foundation program initiatives.

Prior to this Carney held several positions with Altria Corporate Services Inc. most recently as vice president and associate general counsel for corporate and government affairs. Prior to that he served as assistant secretary of Philip Morris Companies Inc. and corporate secretary of Philip Morris Management Corp.

For eight years he was senior international counsel first for General Foods Corporation and later for Kraft Foods Inc. and previously served as trade regulation counsel assistant litigation counsel and federal government relations counsel for General Foods where he began his legal career in 1975 as a division attorney.

Carney is a trustee of Trinity College the University of Virginia Law School Foundation the Riverdale Country School and the Virginia Museum of Fine Arts in Richmond. In addition he is a trustee of the Burke Rehabilitation Hospital in White Plains.

He holds a bachelor’s degree in philosophy from Trinity College and a juris doctor degree from the University of Virginia School of Law.

Name: Amazon
Name_1: Six people killed in Illinois Amazon warehouse collapse after tornado
Text_1:
CNN —

At least six people died at an Amazon (AMZN) warehouse building collapse after an EF-3 tornado caused major structural damage to the building Friday according to the Edwardsville Fire Department in Illinois.

Forty-five people made it out of the building with one person airlifted to a regional hospital for treatment Edwardsville Fire Chief James Whiteford said during a Saturday evening news conference.

Amazon workers identified as dead by the local coroner were Deandre S. Morrow 28 of St. Louis Missouri; Kevin D. Dickey 62 of Carlyle Illinois; Clayton Lynn Cope 29 of Alton Illinois; Etheria S. Hebb 24 of St. Louis Missouri; and Larry E. Virden 46 of Collinsville Illinois. Amazon cargo driver Austin J. McEwen 26 died trying to shelter from a powerful tornado in the bathroom at the warehouse according to a coworker.

“He was my friend and he didn’t make it” said coworker Brian Erdmann who was on his way to make a delivery to the warehouse. “If I would have got back 45 minutes earlier I probably would have been at the same place. I would have been right there with him.”

The recovery phase is expected to take three more days and first responders will continue “to search the site for evidence of life” Whiteford said.

“Earlier this afternoon the response portion of this incident came to a close and we’re now focused solely on recovery” Whiteford said.

Amazon Worldwide Consumer CEO Dave Clark said the company’s staff was saddened at the loss of life at the facility and beyond.

“Our thoughts and prayers are with the victims their loved ones and everyone who has been impacted by the storm’s path across the U.S. We’re continuing to provide support to our employees and partners in the area and across the communities affected by the storms. We also want to thank all of the first responders for their ongoing efforts on the scene” Clark said in a tweet.

Several employees told Reuters that they had been directed to shelter in bathrooms by Amazon managers after receiving emergency alerts on mobile phones from local authorities. The first warning was issued about 40 minutes before the tornado hit according to firefighters and the Illinois governor.

Amazon confirmed in an email that the site got tornado warnings through various alerts. “Our team worked quickly to ensure as many employees and partners could get to the designated Shelter in Place” the company said in a statement. “We thank them for everything they were able to do.”

Workers gave conflicting accounts as to whether the bathroom was the designated shelter. Amazon did not comment.

Some of those workers said they had kept their phones in violation of an Amazon policy that prevents them from having cellphones at work.

The company responded by saying employees and drivers are allowed to have their cellphones.

“I was at the end of my route. I was just getting in the building and they started screaming ‘Shelter in place!’” said David Kosiak 26 who has worked at the facility for three months. “We were in the bathrooms. That’s where they sent us.”

“It sounded like a train came through the building. The ceiling tiles came flying down. It very loud. They made us shelter in place til we left - it was at least two and a half hours in there.”

Retail Wholesale and Department Store Union criticized Amazon for requiring employees to work through a tornado warning.

“This is another outrageous example of the company putting profits over the health and safety of their workers and we cannot stand for this. Amazon cannot continue to be let off the hook for putting hard working people’s lives at risk. Our union will not back down until Amazon is held accountable for these and so many more dangerous labor practices” said Stuart Appelbaum President of the RWDSU.

The chief said approximately 150 yards of the building collapsed after the tornado touched down at 8:35 p.m. CT on Friday.

Edwardsville is approximately 25 miles northeast of St. Louis Missouri.

CNN’s Ramishah Maruf contributed to this report.
